item.title: A Conversation with the R.S., Y.W., and Primary Presidents.
item.description: A Conversation with the R.S., Y.W., and Primary Presidents.

item.title: General Conference Interpretation 50 Years
item.description: The church's interpretation department has come a long way since their small beginnings.

item.title: Beauty and Belief: Islamic Art Exhibit
item.description: A new BYU art exhibit focuses on understanding Islamic faith and culture.

item.title: Jenny Oaks Baker Shares Testimony
item.description: According to classical violinist Jenny Oaks Baker, whose most recent album was nominated for the 54th Grammy Awards’ Best Pop Instrumental Album, there’s a lot more that goes into creating a fairy tale than just wishing—it takes faith and focus.

item.title: Faith, the Musical
item.description: Faith, the Musical portrays the story of the men, women, and children of the Willie handcart company who left Iowa City in July 1856 to make the trek to the Salt Lake Valley.

item.title: World Report April 2017
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Humanum Conference
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar of the Twelve speaks at an interfaith symposium in New York City to address the religious perspective and state of marriage in contemporary society.

item.title: Face 2 Face in Palmyra
item.description: Henry B. Eyring of The First Presidency and Jeffrey R. Holland of the Twelve meet with LDS youth at the birthplace of The Church in Palmyra New York, while connecting with even more young people on Social Media platforms around the globe.

item.title: Cardinal Timothy Dolan Honored
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland of the Twelve and a host of others recognize Cardinal Dolan for his interfaith efforts to advance the cause of Religious Freedom and inclusion.

item.title: BYU Pathway
item.description: New program for Church-sponsored Higher Education is made available online and more accessible to underserved regions of the world.

item.title: Rome Temple and Visitor’s Center
item.description: The revered white-marble Christus Statue, along with other works of art, are reproduced to exactness and installed at the Visitor’s Center in Rome, as the Rome, Italy Temple under construction draws closer to completion.

item.title: Rootstech
item.description: Celebrated guests attend the world’s largest genealogy conference, and share their personal experiences with family history, while Elder Russell M. Nelson of the Twelve extends and invitation.

item.title: Family Discovery Center
item.description: An interactive research center in Salt Lake City puts family history into the hands of the whole family.

item.title: Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs at Presidential Inauguration
item.description: Choir members reflect on the tradition of singing for newly elected U.S. presidents.

item.title: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings Rogers and Hammerstein Standards
item.description: The Grandson of famed lyricist Oscar Hammerstein narrates a special performance at the Conference Center and recalls the impact of the original music and the spiritual nature of the choir.

item.title: Freedmen’s Bureau Record
item.description: The names and lives of freed slaves following the Civil War are indexed by thousands of Latter-day Saint Volunteers and others and finished in 2016, laying further groundwork for African American ancestry research in the United States.

item.title: At the Pulpit
item.description: A new collection of discourses and talks offered by Latter-day Saint women chronicles their contributions to gospel principles from the earliest times of the Church to the present day.

item.title: The Christmas Concert
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs in a holiday tradition with famed tenor Rolando Villazon.

item.title: Light the World
item.description: David A. Bednar of the Twelve reflects on the outreach of a Church-sponsored, Christmas-inspired, social media campaign to serve in faith, which was viewed by more than 83 million people.

item.title: Temple Updates Around The World
item.description: The Paris, France Temple is prepared for its open house to come in April.Ground is broken for temples in the Canadian Province of Manitoba and the Latin American country of Peru.

item.title: Jerusalem
item.description: Apostles Jeffrey R Holland and Quentin L. Cook of the Twelve, and Elder of James J. Hamula of the Seventy, travel to the Holy Land to commemorate the anniversary of Orson Hyde’s dedicatory prayer for the gathering of Israel 175 years ago.

item.title: Church Updates Official "Mormon and Gay" Website
item.description: A Church sponsored webpage is updated, while continuing to offer the welcome of Church leaders to Latter-day Saints who identify as Gay, Lesbian, or Bi-Sexual. The website also offers the personal perspectives of some of these members of The Church.

item.title: World Report October 2016
item.description: The World Report is a semiannual report of news events around the world pertaining to The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Mormons Combating Global Hunger with Donation to World Food Program
item.description: With 65 million refugees worldwide, the Church is committed to alleviating suffering in all its forms, including hunger.

item.title: How the LDS Church is Helping Refugees in Italy
item.description: A brief look at how Mormons are helping refugees in Italy.

item.title: Mormons in Italy Donate Field Kitchen to Italian Red Cross
item.description: Through donations by Mormons each month in what The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints calls fast day, enough money was collected to purchase a mobile kitchen for the Red Cross of Rome.

item.title: Elder Holland Addresses Religious Persecution, Forced Migration at Windsor Conference
item.description: Elder Holland addressed a gathering of humanitarians, scholars, faith and government leaders at a conference at Windsor Castle in the United Kingdom titled “Religious Persecution: The Driver for Forced Migration.”

item.title: Mormon Apostle: Engage in Religious Freedom Debate Constructively
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks encouraged members to get involved “in a constructive way in the vital contest for religious freedom.”

item.title: Bishop W. Christopher Waddell Leads a Recovery Effort After Severe Earthquake in Ecuador
item.description: Bishop Waddell comforts and ministers to earthquake victims during his trip.

item.title: Principles of Self Reliance Embraced by Latter-day Saints in Accra, Ghana
item.description: Principles of Self Reliance Embraced by Latter-day Saints in Accra, Ghana.

item.title: In Louisiana, Mormon Helping Hands Clean Out Flooded Homes
item.description: More than 6,500 volunteers to date from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints assisted with relief efforts in parts of Louisiana damaged by recent record flooding.

item.title: Mormon Tabernacle Choir Returns to Europe after Decades Away Recaptures Iconic Photo
item.description: More than 300 members of the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and 65 members of the Orchestra at Temple Square wrap up a seven-city summer tour in western Europe.

item.title: Mormon Temples Update October 2016
item.description: Thomas S. Monson, president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, announced plans to build four new temples located in Harare, Zimbabwe; Quito, Ecuador; Belém, Brazil; and Lima, Peru.

item.title: President Eyring Dedicates Philadelphia Mormon Temple
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring, first counselor in the First Presidency, dedicated Pennsylvania’s first temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints’ 152nd on Sunday, September 18, 2016.

item.title: University of Utah Names Historic Building After President Monson
item.description: A historic mansion in downtown Salt Lake City has been renamed the Thomas S. Monson Center after the current president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland Honors Boy Scouts in California
item.description: The Scout Oath states, “On my honor, I will do my best to do my duty to God.” Elder Holland hopes these words “never become casual or commonplace.”

item.title: Vietnam Grants Official Recognition to LDS Church
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles said, “We express gratitude and appreciation for the official full recognition of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and its representative committee in Vietnam.”

item.title: Council of Fifty Minutes Featured in New Joseph Smith Papers Volume
item.description: A new volume of never-before-published documents offers a candid view on how early Mormon leaders handled the temporal affairs of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Mormon Missionaries and Philanthropist Partner to Rebuild a Cambodian Village
item.description: Mormon missionaries and a philanthropist are partnering to help Cambodians on a former landfill known as “trash mountain.”

item.title: World Report April 2016
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: A Refugee Remembers – President Uchtdorf
item.description: President Uchtdorf recounts his childhood during WWII and the hardships of refugee life.

item.title: Elder Ballard’s Ministry To Refugees in Europe
item.description: Elder Ballard visits with refugees and children in Berlin and LDS volunteers who are working to help them adapt after being separated from their homelands.

item.title: Reaching Out to Women and Children in Asia
item.description: Sister Marriott and Sister Esplin minister to women and their children in the developing regions of Asia.

item.title: New Apostles Called To The Twelve
item.description: Elder Rasband, Elder Stevenson and Elder Renlund each share their testimonies on the day their respective call to The Twelve.

item.title: Provo City Center Temple
item.description: The history and recent development of the former Provo Tabernacle and it’s transformation into a temple.

item.title: Elder Bednar Confirms Missionary Presence in Liberia
item.description: Elder Bednar meets with members and missionaries in Liberia and dispels concern about the public health of this region in Africa.

item.title: Missionary Update
item.description: Elder Nielsen discusses the numbers of Elders and Sisters serving world-wide from the time of the age of service eligibility announcement.

item.title: Deseret Cattle & Citrus
item.description: The inner workings of a Church-owned ranch and it’s environmental balance.

item.title: Temple Groundbreakings and Dedications
item.description: A fast-paced review of temple developments around the globe.

item.title: Relief Society History Book
item.description: A new volume chronicles the early history of the Relief Society and profiles many of the women who gave so much of their lives to the early church.

item.title: Church History Museum Reopens
item.description: New exhibits on display that tell the early history of the Church.

item.title: RootsTech Conference
item.description: Thousands gather at this annual genealogical conference in Salt Lake City and hear guest presenter and author, Doris Kearns Goodwin.

item.title: Service in Dubai
item.description: The interfaith work of Latter-day Saints to help their neighbors during their religious holiday.

item.title: BYU Hawaii’s New President
item.description: President Tanner takes the reigns of leadership at this island university.

item.title: Ted Koppel Profiles LDS Preparedness
item.description: Renowned journalist tours Church welfare facilities.

item.title: Christmas Concert With Laura Osnes
item.description: Returning broadway star sings with the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and shares her first impressions.

item.title: World Report October 2015
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: President Boyd K. Packer Funeral Service
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer Funeral Services

item.title: Elder L. Tom Perry Funeral Service
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry Funeral Service

item.title: Susquehanna Visitor’s Center Dedication
item.description: News report of the Susquehanna Visitor’s Center Dedication

item.title: Church Growth in Africa
item.description: Mormon newsroom report on Church Growth in Africa

item.title: Elder Jefferey R. Holland Addresses U.K. Leaders
item.description: Elder Jefferey R. Holland is invited to London to address certain members of Parliament regarding the crisis of refugees fleeing religious conflict and civil unrest in their homelands, and what Faith Groups and Governments can do to aid and resolve.

item.title: Freedmen’s Bank & Bureau Records
item.description: mormon newsroom report on Freedmen’s Bank & Bureau Records

item.title: Religious Freedom Ministry
item.description: The universal values of Religious Freedom are shared by members of The First Presidency and The Twelve around the world to a religiously diverse audience.

item.title: Namibia Saints Stand for Religious Freedom
item.description: Latter-day Saints in the African continent of Namibia rise above religious intolerance to affirm their faith.

item.title: Temple Announcements & Ground Breaking
item.description: Latter-day Saint Temples are announced, developed, and dedicated around the world.

item.title: Trujillio Peru Temple Dedication
item.description: Latter-day Saint Temples are announced, developed, and dedicated around the world.

item.title: Indianapolis Indiana Temple Dedication
item.description: Latter-day Saint Temples are announced, developed, and dedicated around the world.

item.title: Cordoba Argentina Temple Dedication
item.description: Latter-day Saint Temples are announced, developed, and dedicated around the world.

item.title: Book of Mormon Manuscript
item.description: The Church publishes the Printer's Manuscript, containing the original hand written content of The Book of Mormon in the latest volume of The Joseph Smith Papers.

item.title: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf Dedicates New Facility at PCC
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf dedicates new buildings that are part of the Polynesian Cultural Center in Hawaii.

item.title: 12 Step Program Stories
item.description: Mormon Newsroom reports on 12 Step Program stories.

item.title: Boy Scouts Of America
item.description: With reaffirmed understanding, The Church continues its partnership with The Boy Scouts of America.

item.title: Arizona State University Institute with Elder Neil A. Andersen
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen dedicates a new Institute of Religion on the campus Arizona State University.

item.title: Elder David A. Bednar Face 2 Face
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar reaches out to LDS youth in a special social media event held on Facebook called "Face2Face".

item.title: Sabbath Day Observance with Elder M. Russell Ballard
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard of The Twelve reminds Latter-day Saints, with the help of other leaders, of the significance of keeping the tenants of Sabbath Day observance.

item.title: The Remote Church in Swakopmund
item.description: The Church flourishes in an unlikely and remote region of Namibia along the Atlantic Coast of Africa.

item.title: Elder Richard G. Scott Funeral Service
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints died Tuesday at 1:45 p.m. MDT from causes incident to age, while surrounded by his family at his home in Salt Lake City. He was 86.

item.title: Elder Scott's Funeral - Newsroom Edition
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints died Tuesday at 1:45 p.m. MDT from causes incident to age, while surrounded by his family at his home in Salt Lake City. He was 86.

item.title: World Report April 2015
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Religious Freedom News Conference
item.description: Leaders of the LDS Church seek to establish a balancing point of our laws as they speak to the free exercise of relating practice and religions.

item.title: Faith Counts
item.description: A new media-driven website, Faithcounts.com, shares stories where the overlapping examples of religion and practice are shown.

item.title: Meet the Mormons, The Red Cross, and Christmas and Easter Media Message
item.description: Meet the Mormons continues to expand its reach online and in other countries, and over $1.8 million in box office proceeds are presented to the American Red Cross. Outdoor billboard and viral video campaigns during the Christmas and Easter season.

item.title: Susquehanna Visitor’s Center
item.description: Plans are on the way to fully develop church historic property in Susquehanna County, PA., the site where Joseph Smith Jr. translation the Book of Mormon and received the priesthood.

item.title: Family Search Discovery Center
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints opens the Family Search Center inside the Joseph Smith Memorial Building that includes interactive displays and hands-on activities to help visitors experience their family history.

item.title: Rootstech
item.description: 21,000 people descended on the Salt Lake City Convention Center to attend Rootstech, the largest family history conference of its kind in the world.

item.title: DC Day of Service
item.description: Tens of thousands of volunteers from different faiths gather at meetinghouses to provide care and service for those in need.

item.title: USS Missouri
item.description: The USS Missouri Memorial Association presents a plaque to honor the missionaries in Hawaii who have been maintaining the USS Missouri for more than a decade.

item.title: Coming Temple Dedications
item.description: Upcoming dedications for temples around the world.

item.title: Phoenix Arizona Temple Dedication
item.description: The 144th Temple of the church in Phoenix, Arizona is dedicated.

item.title: Washington DC Temple Model
item.description: A new highly-detailed miniature model of the Washington, DC Temple is unveiled, allowing visitors to become acquainted with the interior of a building that has been a landmark in the city since 1974.

item.title: Elder Holland’s Interfaith Outreach
item.description: Elder Holland returns to Chapman University to urge the inter-faith audience to stand against forces that would deny them from expressing their faith-influenced voice of conscience.

item.title: Elder L. Tom Perry & The World’s Fair
item.description: L. Tom Perry helps commemorate the 50 year anniversary of the opening of the Mormon pavilion at the 1964 World's Fair, where 5 million visitors took part in the message and visual experience of the Church.

item.title: Women’s Leadership & Goodwill Tour
item.description: Sister Linda K Burton and Sister Neill F. Marriott met with First Leader of Uruguay and made stops around South America, their message centered on the well-being of children and welfare of families.

item.title: BYU Idaho's New President
item.description: Clarke Gilbert will take the reigns of leadership from President Kim B. Clark this fall, becoming the 16th President of BYI-Idaho.

item.title: Provo MTC Renovation
item.description: The MTC in Provo, UT will undergo a transformation this summer with construction of several new buildings for classroom and training space.

item.title: Muppet Christmas Concert
item.description: The Muppets join the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and Orchestra at Temple Square for the annual Christmas Concert.

item.title: Primary Children Celebrate Mandela
item.description: In South Africa, 100 Latter-day Saint boys and girls led a parade of 10,000 in honor of Nelson Mandela.

item.title: Let's Make a Meal
item.description: A church convert launches a cooking class to help prospective missionaries learn how to plan and properly cook for themselves while out in the field.

item.title: Vatican Summit Part II
item.description: Outspoken supporters of marriage in the world of faith and academics, including Church leaders, gather to remind us of the importance of marriage and family.

item.title: World Report October 2014
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: World Report April 2014
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: World Report October 2013
item.description: A look at the Church's activities, accomplishments and service around the world in 2013

item.title: World Report: April 2012 - Full Program
item.description: The full-length broadcast of the April 2012 World Report of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: World Report, October 2011
item.description: A report of the LDS news and events given in October 2011.

item.title: World Report, April 2011
item.description: A report of the LDS news and events given in April 2011.

item.title: World Report, October 2010
item.description: This World Report for October 2010 highlights the new Mormon.org website, the Alex Haley museum, and the dedication of four new temples.

item.title: World Report April 2015
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Twelve Steps to Recovery
item.description: Coordinators and participants in the LDS 12-step addiction recovery program share their stories and their testimonies of the program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Heidi Swinton Interview: President Monson Biography
item.description: Author Heidi Swinton relates a story from President Thomas S. Monson's biography and bears her testimony.

item.title: Finding the Incredible: What Cancer and Trials Can Teach Us
item.description: Daniel and Melanie Hedlund found out Daniel had cancer in December 2007, three weeks after being married.

item.title: Being an Agent to Act
item.description: In this new video series, leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints reassure those who may feel unwelcome in the Church that they are loved and needed. They also encourage members to extend the hand of fellowship to others, regardless of perceived differences.

item.title: Is there a Place for Me?
item.description: In this new video series, leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints reassure those who may feel unwelcome in the Church that they are loved and needed. They also encourage members to extend the hand of fellowship to others, regardless of perceived differences.

item.description: In this new video series, leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints reassure those who may feel unwelcome in the Church that they are loved and needed. They also encourage members to extend the hand of fellowship to others, regardless of perceived differences.

item.description: In this new video series, leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints reassure those who may feel unwelcome in the Church that they are loved and needed. They also encourage members to extend the hand of fellowship to others, regardless of perceived differences.
